intro: Styphelia papillosa, commonly known as the silky lichen or silky mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of trees in the Ericaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a soft, silky appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are leathery and evergreen, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Styphelia papillosa plays a role in forest ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
